    Talks and presentations

    Data Visualization in R

    March 14, 2017

    Tutorial, UC Berkeley - The Hacker Within (Berkeley Institute for Data Science), Berkeley, California

    Following my presentation with David DeTomaso on data transformation in R & Python, I am planning a presentation on the basics of visualization in R, to be followed by a parallel presentation in Python by David on April 18. The Jupyter Notebooks we will use are located in github.com/diyadas/tutorials.

    Data Tidying and Transformation in R & Python

    March 14, 2017

    Tutorial, UC Berkeley - The Hacker Within (Berkeley Institute for Data Science), Berkeley, California

    Together with David DeTomaso and Andrey Indukaev, I planned a presentation on the basics of data tidying and transformation, performing the same operations in parallel for R & Python, demonstrating the versatility of both languages for data analysis. I presented the R sections while David presented the Python sections. The Jupyter Notebooks we used are located in github.com/diyadas/tutorials.

    Deconstructing Olfactory Stem Cell Trajectories at Single Cell Resolution

    January 09, 2017

    Talk, UC Berkeley Developmental & Regenerative Biology Retreat, Berkeley, CA

    I presented several highlights from our single-cell analyses of the trajectories arising from the olfactory stem cell during steady-state differentiation.

    Introduction to R & RStudio

    November 29, 2016

    Tutorial, UC Berkeley - The Hacker Within (Berkeley Institute for Data Science), Berkeley, California

    This introduction to R & RStudio was presented in collaboration with Micha Kahlen.

    Deconstructing Olfactory Stem Cell Trajectories at Single Cell Resolution

    Making a To-Do List That Works for You

    October 21, 2016

    Tutorial, Becoming More Productive: Workflow Strategies for Graduate Students, Berkeley, California

    This presentation was part of a workshop hosted by the UC Berkeley Library for students in the life & health sciences.

    Defining Lineage Trajectories and Cell Fate Transitions During Tissue Regeneration Using Single-Cell RNA Sequencing

    April 24, 2016

    Poster, Berkeley Stem Cell Center Retreat, Asilomar, California

    Authors: Diya Das, Levi Gadye, Michael Sanchez, Kelly N. Street, Davide Risso, Ariane Baudhuin, Michael B. Cole, Allon Wagner, Justin Choi, Elizabeth Purdom, Sandrine Dudoit, Nir Yosef, John Ngai, and Russell B. Fletcher.

    Neural and Non-Neural Epithelia Utilize Overlapping Gene Repertoires During Regeneration

    May 04, 2014

    Poster, Berkeley Stem Cell Center Retreat, Asilomar, California

    Authors: Diya Das, Jose Estrada, Melanie Prasol, Yoon Gi Choi, John Ngai, and Russell B. Fletcher.
